head.supplied: Bot. Gard. 23/6/68 ¶ Dear Sir ¶ ¶ I regret that I should have to trouble you again, with such trifles as chimneys for the lamps, but it appears that the rain enters through some of the holes on top o...

div.p: Unit 733, VPRS 3181/P Town Clerk's file series 1, VA 511 Melbourne, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS is written by Ernst Heyne and signed by M. See also M to E. FitzGibbon, 1 June 1868. Bot. Gard. 23/6/68

I regret that I should have to trouble you again, with such trifles as chimneys for the lamps, but it appears that the rain enters through some of the holes on top of the lamps, a fact which only recently has been ascertained, and falling then on the heated chimney the latter is sure to crack. We shall try whether stopping up these holes will answer.
